page.title: 10FARMING THE LAND (LLWYNDERW)
page.content: Of the 250 acres,52 acres are to the east of the village and some distance away.Plas yn Cwm is the "base"farm. 25 acres are set aside for grazing, 30 acres have,this year,been sown with wheat and the remaining land is for cutting for silage.Contractors cut the wheat,the straw being baled by the local workforce. 2 men are employed at Llwynderw,a tractorman and a dairyman. Milking the dairy cattle begins early at 4-00a.m.and takes 2 hours,in the 7- a-side milking parlour which has auto- detaching milking machines.There is a further milking session which begins at 2-00p.m.Prior to E.E.C.milk quotas, 6,000 litres of milk was produced in a 305 day period whereas now,this has been reduced to 5,500 litres. The soil in the valley is clay while at Hendre Bach it is more sandy.
